channel.title: 111006: ST in Multi-scale Forest Dynamics Models on Multi-scales forest dynamics models
channel.description: Recent content in 111006: ST in Multi-scale Forest Dynamics Models on Multi-scales forest dynamics models

item.description: Note: Due dates of exams and project will not move, however the timeline of topics and smaller assignments might be updated throughout the semester. Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab HW Exam Project Unit 1: Introduction Wed, Jan 10 Introduction. Principles of modelling of forest dynamics Thur, Jan 11 Journal Club Unit 2: Types of models.

item.title: Models
item.description: This is a list of the models that we will cover/mention during the lectures. The list is not comprehensive, and there are many models that we do not cover due to lack of time. For a more thorough list of available models, we suggest to check REF. Process-based models Participation & application exercises 10% SORTIE-ND 1996 Pacala et al.

item.title: Policies
item.description: Class: Class time is designed to be as interactive as possible. My role as instructor is to introduce you new tools and techniques, but it is up to you to take them and make use of them. Programming is a skill that is best learned by doing, so as much as possible you will be working on a variety of tasks and activities throughout each class. Diversity & Inclusiveness: It is my intent that students from all diverse backgrounds and perspectives be well-served by this course, that students' learning needs be addressed both in and out of class, and that the diversity that the students bring to this class be viewed as a resource, strength and benefit.
